extensionDescription.message: Text template manager and utility toolkit for professionals: CEP/address search, number to text converter, document formatter, advanced text cleaning, useful links, and TJSP process query.

placeholderSearchTemplates.message: Search by name, category, tags, or content...

bulkActionsSelected.description: Text 'selected' for the bulk actions counter.

helpTextCustomConstants.message: Create placeholders with fixed values (e.g., {MY_EMAIL}). Use uppercase letters, numbers, and underscore (_).

titleConstantNamePattern.message: Use only uppercase letters, numbers, and underscore

helpTextReusableVariables.message: Define variable names (e.g., {CUSTOMER_NAME}). The value will be requested once when copying a template that uses it. Use uppercase letters, numbers, and underscore (_).

helpTextBackupRestore.message: Save or restore all your templates and settings.

docIntro.message: Welcome to Facilita! This tool is designed to streamline your workflow by combining advanced text template management with practical utilities.

docGiveUniqueName.message: Give it a unique name (e.g., "Simple Greeting").

docEnterText.message: In the editor, type your desired text (e.g., "Hello! Have a great day.").

docPasteText.message: Go to any text field (in an email, form, etc.) and paste (Ctrl+V or Cmd+V).

docAddCategory.message: When creating or editing, add a Category (e.g., "Emails", "Quick Replies").

docAddTags.message: Add Tags (comma-separated, e.g., "important, client, follow-up") for finer filtering.

docUseFilters.message: Use the filters in the <kbd>My Templates</kbd> tab to find what you need.

docPlaceholdersIntro.message: Placeholders are special codes that are replaced with dynamic information when you copy a template.

docAutoPlaceholdersDesc.message: These are automatically replaced at the time of copying:

docPH_SEMANA.message: Day of the week in full (e.g., Wednesday).

docPH_URL.message: URL of the active page in the browser (if applicable).

docPH_TITLE.message: Title of the active page in the browser (if applicable).

docPH_CLIPBOARD.message: Current content of the clipboard (requires permission).

docCustomConstantsDesc.message: Define fixed values in the <kbd>Settings</kbd> tab. Useful for information that doesn't change, like your email or company name.

docCCD_NamingRules.message: Naming Rules: Use only uppercase letters, numbers, and underscore (_).

docVariablesDesc.message: These are placeholders whose value is requested in a popup window whenever you copy a template containing them.

docVR_ReusableDesc.message:
Defined in the Settings tab (e.g., CUSTOMER_NAME). If a template uses {CUSTOMER_NAME} multiple times, or if one template invokes another that also uses {CUSTOMER_NAME}, the value will be requested only once per copy.
Usage: Hello {CUSTOMER_NAME}, how are you?

docVR_InstanceDesc.message:
Created directly in the editor. Each {VAR:...} is treated as unique, even if the label is the same. The value will be requested for each occurrence.
Usage: Process: {VAR:Process Number}, Defendant: {VAR:Defendant Name}

docVR_InputDesc.message:
Similar to {VAR:...}, but presents a larger text box in the popup, allowing multi-line input.
Usage: Additional Observations: {INPUT:Describe details here}

docVR_Tip.message: Tip: Use Reusable Variables for information that repeats in the same context (like customer name), and {VAR} or {INPUT} for specific, one-off pieces of information.

docInvokingDesc.message: You can insert the content of one template into another using double curly braces.

docIT_UsageDesc.message: The content of "ExactNameOfTemplate" will be inserted at this point. Placeholders within the invoked template will also be processed (constants, automatic, and variables will be requested if necessary).

docIT_WarningDesc.message: Avoid creating cycles (Template A invokes B, which invokes A). The extension detects and prevents cycles to avoid crashes.

docAdvancedFormattingDesc.message: Add modifiers to your {VAR:...}, {INPUT:...}, or numeric constants for special formatting:

docAF_ExtensoMoeda.message: :extenso_moeda - E.g.: {VAR:FinalPrice:extenso_moeda} for "one hundred twenty-three dollars and fifty cents".

docAF_ExtensoF.message: :extenso_f - E.g.: {VAR:Quantity:extenso_f} for "two" (if value is 2, feminine form if applicable in the language).

docAF_Moeda.message: :moeda(CODE,N) - E.g.: {VAR:Budget:moeda(USD,2)} for "$1,234.57" (CODE is currency code, N decimal places).

docAF_DataFormat.message: {DATA:format(FORMAT)} - E.g.: {DATA:format(MMMM DD, YYYY)} for "June 02, 2025". See documentation for all format tokens.

docEx1_Title.message: Example 1: Complete Email with Invocation and Variables

docEx1_HeaderContent.message:
Dear {CUSTOMER_NAME},

I hope this email finds you well.
docEx1_HeaderContent.description: pre. Keep <code> tags implicitly via pre.

docEx1_BodyContent.message:
Please find attached the proposal for the {VAR:Service Name} service.
The total amount is $ {VAR:Proposal Amount:decimal(2)} ({VAR:Proposal Amount:extenso_moeda}).

If you have any questions, I'm at your disposal.
docEx1_BodyContent.description: pre. Keep <code> tags implicitly via pre.

docEx1_FullEmailContent.description: pre. Keep <code> tags implicitly via pre.

docEx1_P_Step1.message: The value for CUSTOMER_NAME will be requested (Reusable Variable, asked once).

docEx1_P_Step2.message: The value for Service Name will be requested (from {VAR:Service Name} in "Proposal Body").

docEx1_P_Step3.message: The value for Proposal Amount will be requested (from {VAR:Proposal Amount:decimal(2)} in "Proposal Body"). The value will be formatted with 2 decimal places and as currency in text.

docEx1_P_Step4.message: The value for Service Name will be requested again (from {VAR:Service Name} in the Subject of "Full Proposal Email" - note that {VAR} is always unique).

docFaq_NotCopiedTitle.message: Template is not copied or inserted correctly.

docFaq_NotCopiedDesc1.message: Check if there is an active and editable text field on the page where you want to paste. The extension needs a place to insert the content (like an email box, form, online text editor).

docFaq_NotCopiedDesc2.message: If you are pasting into a very specific editor (like Google Docs/Sheets or desktop applications), rich HTML formatting might not be fully supported. The extension also tries to copy as plain text; try pasting again.

docFaq_AutoPlaceholderFailTitle.message: Automatic placeholders ({DATA}, {URL}, etc.) are not working.

docFaq_AutoPlaceholderFailDesc1.message: Ensure the placeholder is written exactly as in the documentation (uppercase, no extra spaces within the braces).

docFaq_AutoPlaceholderFailDesc2.message: For {URL} and {TITLE}, the extension needs access to the active tab. Check that you are not trying to use it on an internal browser page (chrome://...) or a page where the extension does not have permission.

docFaq_AutoPlaceholderFailDesc3.message: For {CLIPBOARD}, the browser may ask for permission to access the clipboard. Make sure you have granted permission.

docFaq_InvocationCycleTitle.message: I get the error "Invocation cycle detected".

docFaq_InvocationCycleDesc1.message: This happens when a template tries to invoke itself, directly or indirectly. For example:

docFaq_InvocationCycleEx2.message: Template A contains {{Template B}}, and Template B contains {{Template A}}

docFaq_InvocationCycleEx3.message: Template A invokes B, B invokes C, and C invokes A.

docFaq_InvocationCycleDesc2.message: Review the templates involved in the error message and remove the cyclic invocation.

docFaq_VarNotPromptedTitle.message: {VAR:...} or {INPUT:...} variables are not being prompted.

docFaq_VarNotPromptedDesc1.message: Check the exact syntax in the template editor. It should be {VAR:Your Label Here} or {INPUT:Your Instruction Here}, with at most one optional modifier after a colon (e.g., {VAR:Price:decimal(2)}). No extra spaces before or after the colon (:) and with the label/instruction present.

docFaq_VarNotPromptedDesc2.message: If an invoked template contains the variable, it will only be prompted if the main template is copied.

docFaq_BackupTitle.message: How do I back up my templates and settings?

docFaq_BackupDesc1.message: Go to the <kbd>Settings</kbd> tab and use the buttons in the "Backup and Restore" section:

docFaq_BackupExport.message: Export All: Saves a .json file with all your templates and settings. Keep this file in a safe place.

docFaq_BackupImport.message: Import File: Allows you to select a previously exported .json backup file to restore all data. Warning: This will overwrite all current templates and settings!

docFaq_TagSearchFailTitle.message: Tag search doesn't find my template.

docFaq_TagSearchFailDesc1.message: The specific tag search (field "Filter by tags...") requires the template to contain all tags entered in the filter, separated by commas.

docFaq_TagSearchFailEx.message: Example: If you filter by urgent, client, only templates that have BOTH "urgent" AND "client" tags will appear.

docFaq_TagSearchFailDesc2.message: The general search (main field) looks for the word anywhere (name, category, content, or tags).

docFaq_TagSearchFailDesc3.message: Check if the tags were saved correctly in the template (when editing) and if there are no typos.

docFaq_ReportBugTitle.message: How to report a bug or suggest improvements?

docFaq_ReportBugDesc1.message: If you find a problem not listed here, or have ideas for new features, please report it!

docFaq_ReportBugItem1.message: Detailed description of the problem or suggestion.

docFaq_ReportBugItem2.message: Steps to reproduce the error (if applicable).

docFaq_ReportBugItem3.message: Error messages that appear (check the popup console - right-click on the popup > Inspect > Console).
